data.question: What is the empirical formula of the complex [14+•(Ag+•4•5)]•[14+•(Ag2+•52•4H2O)]•29H2O?
What is the crystal system of the complex [(14+)2•54•(Cd2+)4•(HO-)4•4H2O]•19H2O?
What is the space group of the complex [14+•(Ag+•4•5)]•[14+•(Ag2+•52•4H2O)]•29H2O?
What is the activation energy (ΔG≠) for the conformational flipping of 14+ within the [3]rotaxane complex [(14+)2•53•(Ag+)5]4+?
What is the association constant (Ka) for the equilibrium between [14+] and [5] forming [14+•5]+?
Does the addition of I– to the solution of [(14+)2•53•(Ag+)5]4+ lead to complete decomposition of the complex?
data.answer: No, the addition of 2 molar equiv of I– leads to noticeable but incomplete decomposition after 48 hours.

data.question: Can the decomposition-construction cycle of [(14+)2•53•(Ag+)5]4+ with I– and Ag+ be repeated multiple times?
data.answer: Yes, the cycle can be repeated a number of times.

data.question: What effect does adding small molecules like D2O, methanol-d4, or acetonitrile-d3 have on the rate constant (kc) of the chair-to-chair conformational flipping of 14+ within [(14+)2•53•(Ag+)5]4+?
data.answer: The rate constant (kc) is linearly correlated with the percentage of small molecules added.

data.question: Is the complexation mode of Cd2+ in the structure of [(14+)2•54•(Cd2+)4•(HO-)4•4H2O]•19H2O stabilized by intermolecular hydrogen bonding interactions?
data.answer: Yes, the complexation mode is stabilized by intermolecular hydrogen bonding interactions.

data.question: What is the role of Cd2+ cations in the structure of [(14+)2•54•(Cd2+)4•(HO-)4•4H2O]•19H2O?
data.answer: Cd2+ cations act as bridging units for the anionic components 5 that interpenetrate the cavity of 14+, resulting in a rotaxane-containing metal organic framework.
